text:
It was absolutely wonderful. I used Ditalini pasta instead of elbow. My salad came out orange due to the smoked paprika I used. I used a lot of it. I also used ground Chipotle pepper for its smokey flavor and hotness. It really gave the salad a kick. I used extra vinegar, extra kosher salt and less sugar. I used miracle whip & mustard but I omitted the pimento peppers because I couldn't find them at the store. I also used red onions, shredded cheddar cheese and boiled eggs. Everybody loved it.

text:
Best macaroni salad I've had in years!!!  The dressing is amazing and that's more than half the battle when it comes to wonderful macaroni salad!  I did tweak it a little;  about 5-6C macaroni noodles,   a little over a 1/3C of sugar,  1 1/2 C mao(Dukes),  3-4 hard boiled eggs chopped up,  cider vinegar and a generous splash of milk.  Heavenly,  Divine and Perfect!  Thank you so very much for sharing !!!  Reminded me of so many lovely memories of my childhood and the family  that surrounded me......Thank you again!

text:
New favorite macaroni salad recipe!
I of course made a few tweaks. I didn't have fresh celery, next time I will use celery. I also halved the amount of sugar because 2/3 cups just seemed like too much, 1/3 cup was perfect. I added 1 small cucumber, grated (about a cup). I also added about 1/4 tsp cayenne powder. I only had 1/2 green bell pepper diced and 1/2 of a medium purple onion diced, so I used that. It was just right flavor in my book. We will definitely be making this again. My husband said, "you need to make this more often." Even my five year old who is on the fence about pasta and macaroni salads ate what I gave him!
Winner winner, macaroni salad with dinner!

text:
This is a delicious and very versatile recipe. Per other reviewers, I cut the sugar to 1/4 cup. I would definitely not use more than this as 1/4 cup is on the brink of being overly sweet. I used cider vinegar (which I think was a tad too strong a taste for this dish... I will use the white distilled, as called for, the next time.) I added cubed cheese, green onion, and a sprinkling of dried parsley. I omitted the pimentos as I didn't have any on hand. Everything else in the recipe I kept the same. My husband loved it so much, he asked me to write it down so that I can make it again. (I have a habit of making dishes and then forgetting what recipe I used when I want to make it again.) A+ on this one!

Absolutely excellent.  I was skeptical about the sugar (especially after reading some of the reviews), because I'm not usually a "sweet" fan.   But I nervously put in all the sugar called for and it is perfect.  Seriously.   I wouldn't change a thing.  

I didn't have carrots and pimentos, so I did omit those.  And I only used half an onion (just a personal preference).   

Honestly, I think this is the best classic macaroni salad I've ever had or made.  I'm excited to have found this recipe!

text:
I've made this many times, and it has always been a crowd favorite. I do add some chopped hard boiled egg, and tweaked it with  garlic and onion powder. Make sure you make extra sauce or add less macaroni.... the noodles will absorb the sauce   while chilling.  The first batch I ever made was a tad dry. Leaving it chill overnight completes the process. An excellent recipe in my opinion. Oh yea, one last thing, add some halved cherry tomatoes... it gives it some color and adds to the overall flavor and appeal.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674147.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I searched for "classic macaroni salad," and this recipe came up #1 in search results.  (I've eaten it, but I've never made it before.  I wanted to experiment with a trusted, well-rated recipe.)  I'll admit, though, I couldn't make myself use the 2/3 c. sugar called for in the recipe.  We don't eat a ton of sugar, and it just seemed like...a lot.  I ended up using 1/3 c. knowing I could always add more.  I didn't have any pimentos on hand, so I added half a red pepper for color.  Followed the rest of the recipe as written.  I didn't add more sugar -- it was plenty sweet for us -- but I understand that's subjective.  The salad itself was ok.  No complaints, but nothing about it really stood out.  If I use this recipe again I'll probably cut the sugar back further to 1/4 c. I'd also consider a different type of vinegar (maybe apple cider or white wine) and/or a different mustard (maybe dijon or spicy brown) for a little different flavor.

5

This was my 1st time making macaroni salad and it was very good. I used this recipe  and slightly modified the ingredients. For example, to ensure my macaroni salad was not too sweet I reduced the amount of sugar and white vinegar,.  I also added  more mayo so salad was very creamy.  Additionally, I hard boil eggs that I chop up and add it to my macaroni salad with a little paprika on top.

Thank you to the person who shared this recipe . My family really enjoyed the macaroni salad.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674151.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
The basics of this recipe were really good, however, it is too sweet (even after chilling for 4+ hours) and I even backed off on the sugar by only adding 1/2 cup. So I will use 1/3 c or 1/4 c sugar next time.   I also added one diced dill pickle to break up the sweet a little.  I used Apple cider vinegar instead of white vinegar.  I decreased the prepared yellow mustard to 1 Tbsp only because I did not want the mustard to overpower the other flavors and I didn't want the salad to be so yellow, but I did add about a 1 tsp of ground mustard.  Lastly I used 1/2 red onion, instead of 1 white onion, for added color and I prefer the flavor of red onion.  I did not add the pimento as I do not care for that flavor but I did add the carrot.   All in all, I will definitely make this again!

text:
This is the  best tasting Mac salad ever! I used Dijon mustard and decreased by 1 tsp only because my family are not mustard fans.  I also used purple onions and gently blanched them. I am not a fan of raw onions. 
I made sure the Mac was very aldente because it really soaks up the dressing and becomes very tender. 
•••Most important. Let it rest in the refergirator over night.  It will soak up the dressing and become tender.  Do NOT over cook the Mac!

As many people have said, I did find it a little too sweet but I also used Apple cider vinegar instead of white vinegar which tends to be a little sweeter. I also found I wanted it a little saltier, but that's just personal preference. I also added garlic powder because I add it to everything. I think this is a good recipe. I always just use my favorite vegetables for these kinds of things, so I just used carrots, bell peppers (using all 3 colors makes it a very colorful dish), cucumber, and black olives. I added onion powder to the dressing as well since I didn't include whole onions.

text:
Absolutely disgusting. This recipe is sweeter than most desserts. My instincts said run away and I should have listened. I'm not sure that salvaging the recipe would even be worth it, but if I tried, I'd eliminate all sugar and all vinegar, add 4 minced hard-boiled eggs, and add 1 cup each of diced green peppers, and sliced radish and 1/2 cup each of packed grated carrot, diced celery, minced onion, and chopped parsley. In other words, I wouldn't make this recipe at all. I hate to give a bad review to any submitted recipe, but this demands a response. Don't do it. There are better recipes everywhere.

I have made this recipe many times and I am often asked to bring it to parties. I make it exactly as written minus carrots.   Do make it the night before so the flavors meld. When melding the macaroni absorbs the sauce, so reserve a small amount to apply right before serving. This one is a keeper!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I'm giving this recipe 4 stars because I don't think it was the perfect recipe. It did give good direction and inspiration and had all the elements to make the dish perfectly to my taste. I didn't add any ingredients in its entirety from the beginning and added more or less to taste. I ended up using the recommended amount of mayonnaise, vinegar, salt, ground pepper, and celery. I added 1/2 of the sugar, 1/2 an onion because I felt it might be too strong, I didn't add a green bell pepper because I didn't have any on hand. I added a red bell pepper. I finely grated 1 whole carrot which came to about 1/2 cup. I added about 2 teaspoons garlic powder to taste. I would have added peas or corn but because it was for a potluck, I wanted to keep it as traditional as possible. Will definitely make this in the future!

text:
This is the first thing I've ever made, that people asked me to make again. Just for that, I give it 5 stars. :) Recipe is easy to follow and delicious. I made it exactly according to the recipe the first time - people, this makes A LOT of pasta salad. We took to church potluck, gave some to my parents, gave some to my in-laws, gave some to the neighbors, and still had plenty for us. Second time, I cut the recipe in half - still had a lot but was just right for gathering of 8-10 adults + kids. Was asked to make it for a third time today (this is a first in my 38 years of life) and will be trying it with olive oil mayonnaise and adding some paprika (found in other reviews). This is a great recipe for a non-cook who needs to bring something to the event - easy to make and people love it!

city:

None
country:
None
text:
I made it and my family loved it! I used a 1/2 C sugar, just to cut down on the sweetness. I followed the rest of the recipe to the letter. The only thing I did that was different, is that I made two full batches of the dressing in two separate bowls. In one large bowl of dressing, I added my onions, peppers, celery, three hard boiled eggs, macaroni and mixed well then refrigerated. I placed the second small bowl of dressing in the refrigerator as well. As my macaroni absorbed it's dressing, I had additional dressing on hand, that I could add so the salad didn't dry out. It was very creamy and delicious.

text:
I eat gluten free, so I used gluten free Barilla pasta and this turned out great.  The gluten free pasta comes in smaller boxes (12 oz. versus 16), so I used the rotini pasta, which is larger than elbow macaroni, and it worked out perfectly.  I took it to a spring luncheon/potluck and it was a hit.  I don't think anyone guessed that it was gluten free because it was so tasty.  This is a keeper for sure!

text:
The first time I made this salad I made it directly as the recipe stated and I thought it was ok. My husband thought it was too sugary and sweet so the 2nd time I read a few reviews and combined different aspects.  I had changed the servings to 6 so it is a little less than what is the original keep in mind. I added 1/4 a red pepper, diced carrots, I cut the sugar in half, added 3 eggs, reduced the vinegar a smidge, added about 1/2 tsp of garlic powder. This was amazing and a big hit for everyone.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Five stars because, like many others, I find it's absolutely wonderful exactly as presented, But the recipe also has two great strengths: 1. It's versatile and there are a whack of additional ingredients you can add, according to personal preference and taste, without in any way ruining it (roasted red peppers, olives, frozen peas, hard boiled egg, green onion, green or red pepper, corn niblets, for example, little pea-size cubes of cheddar cheese); even the white vinegar can be replaced with red wine vinegar, white wine vinegar or apple cider vinegar without ruining the recipe, these merely add a more slightly fruity accent; and 2. The secret key is the vinegar, sugar, mayonnaise, dry mustard, salt and pepper sauce. It needs nothing more.

text:
I added about 3/4 cup of sliced black olives along with a generous cup of cubed Colby cheese. Tip:  the outside of the macaroni box says 16 oz when in actuality it was exactly 4 cups. This recipe needs to sit for 24 hours uncovered or else it will be runny. Be patient. This is an awesome recipe that my family LOVED!  I will be making this again for sure. This recipe will make a huge bowl so it is great for a large family or party. Also I chose to leave out the carrots and palmettos.

This is the very first recipe I found on this site.  I have never been a huge cold pasta fan .... until now!

Making it the day ahead of time makes a world of difference in the flavor.  I love to make this pasta along with roasted chicken breasts and fresh fruit for a large gathering of friends and family.  They fight to see who gets to take home the leftovers (if there are any!)

I did cut the sugar in half like others recommended. I do add blanched broccoli flourettes for additional veggies, color and textures.

text:
As you would guess by the 4 cups of uncooked macaroni, this recipe makes a ton!!  I used less sugar (about 1/2 c.) and didnt add the optional grated carrot or pimentos.  I made the dressing the day or 2 before and then added to the chilled macaroni the day of.  I wish I had doubled the dressing because it seemed a little dry - I wouldn't have needed double, but probably 1.5x the original amount.  Although it would have been nice to have extra to add if needed when we ate it as leftovers.  Would be good with cut up crab.  I gave it a 4 instead of 5 stars because although it was good, it was just a basic salad and nothing too exciting.  
Thanks for the recipe!

text:
I made this recipe as written, using the optional pimentos but not the carrots (only because I didn't have carrots on hand). I think the salad would have been even better with the orange color and crunchy texture of carrots, although it was very crunchy and textured without them. It was delicious as written, but adding some Jane's Krazy Mixed-Up Salt improved it and added an extra layer of flavor. This is a perfect easy potluck dish and tastes just like the macaroni salad you get from the deli.

Edit: It's even better on day two! Let it sit in the fridge overnight.

region:

country:
None
text:
Great base for a recipe! I also made many changes:
I used half mayo, half miracle whip for a total of 1.5 cups, 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar, 1/4 cup sugar, 1 Tbsp. mustard and 1 tsp. each garlic powder, season salt and pepper. Used 4 veggies: 1 red and 1 yellow bell pepper, 2 carrots, and 2 stalks celery. I also added 8 slices cooked chopped bacon. Made this for a work party and it was gone in 5 minutes!!! With these changes everyone said it was the best pasta salad they ever had, 9 people asked for the recipe!

text:
I halved the sugar to 1/3 C. and it was STILL too much sugar. I ended up making a whole other half batch, sans the sugar, just so I could cut the sweetness down to a tolerable level. It perhaps had too much vinegar, too, but maybe I just didn't like the recommended vinegar because it was just so cloyingly sweet. It was like eating tangy candy! If you're not a fan of sweet salads, I'd recommend only adding a tablespoon of sugar.

I basically followed the directions to the T...
 All i did was a dded 3 eggs, and doubled it. This was VERY wet, even after sitting OVER 8 hours in the fridge!!! I was expecting a creamy end result!!!!
 And the after taste is a bit strong of onion. 
Was a TAD on the sweet side, but the tang of the vinegar kinda compensated for that.

 Good base to tweak next time.... OK IF YOU use it "AS-IS"; unless you like a very wet, tart and tangy Mac salad with a onion after taste....!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made this earlier today for the 4th of July tomorrow & I can't stop eating it!! Delicious!! I did change a few things though and did add some things. I felt that much sugar is just crazy so I only used 1/2 tablespoon probably pointless but that’s what I used. I only used half a red onion and it still has a lot of onion flavor which is fine with me but for others it may be too much.  I didn’t use celery or pimentos. I did use the carrots and green pepper. I also used 3 hard boiled eggs and mild shredded cheddar.  I used 50 % more mayo and another tablespoon or so of mustard. We will see what everyone thinks tomorrow but my husband & I already love it & can’t stop eating it! Hopefully it will last and be around tomorrow if we don’t eat it all before then.

text:
I couldn't bring myself to use a whole 2/3 cup of sugar, so I only used about 2 Tbsp, but then reduced the mustard by about half so it wouldn't be too tart.  I still had to add about another 1/2 cup of mayo, as the pasta sort of soaked that up after a while.  I used 1/2 cup chopped vidalia onion, one stalk celery and one small red bell pepper.    I also added about 4 chopped hard-boiled eggs, as we like eggs in our macaroni salad.  Ended up being a crowd pleaser!

text:
zesty...and family approved. Will make again and again. Super easy to throw together. I was worried at first bc the sauce was runny. I threw the elbow mac. & sauce in separate bowls in the fridge and let them chill until I needed it. Once we were ready for lunch I made sandwiches and threw the elbow mac. & sauce together and voila! I made this on a short notice as a side to go with my club sandwich.   Yummy!

text:
I give this recipe five solid stars, though I did make some changes to original: - My husband's allergic to carrot so I substituted a large handful of fresh peas.  - added two hard boiled eggs. - I'm a huge fan of apple cider vinegar so I added that instead of distilled and the flavor really came through beautifully! - Lastly, I added about half a tablespoon of dill and used fresh ground peppercorns equaling about 1 teaspoon (I love the stuff!).  The dressing was wonderful, creamy and flavorful. The recipe also made enough for a large family gathering or party! Will make again!

userID:
5068722
Display Name:
Bethy
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674135.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
A very nice standard Mac Salad with a zippy flavor.  Not bland like a reg Mac salad with just Mayo. I didn't have white ditilled vin but I did have some rice wine vin. That is already sweetend and I added sugar to taste. I also added eggs as I felt my family would miss them. Also I want to note that people are saying that it is watery. Tto avoid this, do not rinse your pasta and let it steam off excess water in the strainer not a bowl until cool. and also refrigerate for the 4 hours, it will be perfect.

text:
I was not incredibly impressed with this salad.  I, like a number of other reviewers, found it to be a bit too sweet for my taste.  I prepared it for a dinner at my in-laws and initially only let it chill for around six hours.  It was ok then, but very sweet.  I then let the leftovers chill overnight and tried the salad again without much change in the flavor.  I did add three hard boiled eggs, but other than that I prepared it exactly as directed.  I may try the recipe again, but alter it as previously suggested and use less sugar.

text:
I made this recipie for 50 people and only had to make a few adjustments. I ended up adding an extra 2 cups of mayo, decreased the amount of onions, switched the green peppers with pickle relish and I added shredded cheddar cheese and hardboiled eggs. I would probably not add the hardboiled eggs next time as it just didn't seem to "mesh" well with how the rest of the recipie tasted.  Also I noticed that the macaroni absorbed the creamy dressing once it cooled so cooling the macaroni first would probably fix this problem.

text:
This was an easy macaroni salad and, while its still melding in the fridge, the preliminary tests came out very good. I made it as specified but with whip instead of mayo, and one and a halved the recipe (6 cups pasta, everything else increased proportionally).  I will likely make again for future cookouts, as the macaroni salad they sell pre-made tends to be a little heavy and gross. This has a nice fresh, clean feeling.

text:
AWESOME! Was looking for a mac salad to accompany a dish modeled after a famous local eatery--a deep-fried half chicken liberally doused in the restaurant's signature "Sassy Sauce"--the "bird" is placed atop two slices of white bread, with mac salad on the side to cool off your taste buds off between bites.  This mac salad was not too mayonaiss-y... it was tart yet sweet; perfect.  Would not change a thing (except next time I will maybe add more celery and/or red bell pepper!)  It was great combined with the "birds" but would be a super side dish with any picnic-style fare.  It lives up to its name:  CLASSIC...

text:
This is an excellent variation to macaroni salad, especially for those that like a bit of zing.  I'm not a big fan of jalapenos, but I have to say this is by far my new favorite macaroni salad.  It was not too hot, just right.  Keep in mind, that I DID remove the seeds from the jalapenos.  My husband, on the other hand, is a huge fan of hot sauce, peppers, etc.  Even though this was not over-the-edge hot, he enjoyed it as well.  Great recipe!

text:
This was THE best recipe.  I made some changes since I did not have everything exact.  I used rice vinegar instead of what was called for since that's what I had on hand. I also used roasted red peppers from a jar verses the green peppers and I added celery seed since I did not have celery.  It was great.  I just mixed everything to taste rather than exactly what the recipe called for.  It was great tasting, especially the next day.  We finished the entire dish instead of having leftovers left in the fridge.  My husband loved it.  It was a hit and I will keep that in the box for future reference.

text:
This was pretty good.  Very creamy.  My first thought though is that it tastes like a potato salad rather than macaroni salad.  I would definitely recommend letting it sit overnight as it was much better the next day.  It really needed time to firm up.  When I first made it, I thought it was too runny but the next day it had the consistency of macaroni salad.
